definitions.definition: a soft substance that is like a wet powder and consists of very small pieces of a solid material that have fallen to the bottom of a liquid:
examples: There was a brown sediment in the bottom of the bottle.

definitions.definition: sand, stones, etc. that slowly form a layer of rock:
examples: It is hoped that the oil slick will sink to the seabed where it would be covered within a few years by sediments and eventually decompose.
